newsitem.title: CHINA: China tinplate production growth seen causing glut.
newsitem.headline: China tinplate production growth seen causing glut.

text.p: China's tinplate production capacity is expected to hit 1.1 million tonnes a year by 2000 but domestic demand will be just 700,000-800,000 tonnes, causing a major glut in the metal, the Market Daily said on Friday.
In 1996, Chinese demand for tinplate was 500,000 tonnes, well ahead of total domestic production capacity of just 250,000 tonnes, the newspaper said.
It blamed the expected steep rise in production capacity on a number of what it called unnecessary projects that would go into operation over the next several years.
Most of the projects currently under construction were foreign-funded plants that would sell their output on the domestic market instead of concentrating on exports, it said.
Experts had called for restrictions to be placed on the construction of new tinplate plants over the next several years, the newspaper said but gave no further details.
